headline: Edo Refinery: Plant to source crude from Escravos line – Obaseki – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestBENIN CITY – The Edo State Governor, Mr. Godwin Obaseki has said the Edo Modular Refinery being developed by Edo Refinery and Petrochemical Company Limited (ERPC) with support from the state government, in Ologbo, Ikpoba – Okha Local Government Area, will source crude for processing from the Escravos Line.
The governor, who spoke during a recent inspection of the facility, said the crude sales agreement is being finalized in readiness for production, which is scheduled to begin in August this year.
“What we have left now is to finalise the crude oil sales contract; these facilities have to get a certain type of crude from the Escravos line and that is being finalized.

headline: IGR: Edo govt tasks MDAs on automation – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestBENIN CITY – The Edo State Government has tasked Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs) to key into the automated Internally Generated Revenue (IGR) system now operational in the state.
The charge was given by the Head of Service, Anthony Okungbowa Esq, at a two-day training workshop on Electronic Treasury Receipt and MDA Certificate Approval, organized by the Edo State Internal Revenue Service (EIRS) for Permanent Secretaries, Directors and Heads of Revenue drawn from various MDAs in Edo State.
Executive Chairman Edo State Internal Revenue Service, (EIRS), Igbinidu Inneh said the system was conceived to enable government to electronically track transactions with individuals and organizations, particularly as it relates to government applications and approvals.
He noted that this was to ensure that officials of government comply with the relevant tax laws to avoid being sanctioned.
Other benefits of the electronic treasury receipts and MDA certificate approvals include the issuance of verifiable electronic documents, as well as realtime reporting of all MDA transactions, amongst others.

headline: Gun men kill Police Escort, Driver Of APC Chieftain In Delta – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestWarri – A gang of yet to be identified gunmen on Sunday morning, killed a mobile police escort and driver of All Progressive Congress (APC), Chief Michael Johnny at the ever busy Airport Junction in Uvwie Local Government Area of Delta state.
The deceased mobile police identified as Inspector Samuel Arigbanmigha and the deceased driver Stephen Okhea were said be on official duty to escort their boss’s wife, Mrs. Johnny to church when the incident occurred.
Nigerian Observer, gathered that , they had dropped Mrs. Johnny off at the church and were on their way to run another errand when they were accosted at about 11;12am by their assailants who trailed after them in a yellow Lexus Jeep.
The deceased policeman and driver according witnesses at the crime scene , were accosted and reportedly shot at a close range on the head and stomach , killing the duo instantly.
Divisional Police Officer (DPO), Enerhen Division, CSP Mukhtari Bello, led his men to the conduct preliminary investigations on the incident.

headline: Fire erupts in building at TB Joshua’s funeral
summarized_story:
ADVERTISEMENTFire erupted in a building inside the Synagogue Church Of All Nations headquarters in Lagos Monday night as the funeral ceremony of TB Joshua, the founder of the church, got underway.
The fire, which was noticed at about 11 p.m., affected a building that a witness said housed a store on the premises, some metres away from the church’s main auditoriumThe cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained but the witness, who did not want to be named because he was not authorised to speak, said it resulted from an electrical spark.
As of midnight, the fire has been largely contained by a crowd of worshippers who were using containers to scoop water from near the church and dashing to douse the flames.
Officials of the Lagos State Fire Service arrived at about 12:15 a.m.Mr Joshua’s weeklong funeral ceremony began on July 5 with a candlelight procession at the church’s prayer mountain in Ikotun, Lagos.
Other activities lined up for the ceremony include a tribute service on July 6 and 7, lying-in-state on July 8, laying to rest and internment on July 9, and a thanksgiving service on July 11The popular televangelist died on June 5, according to his church, a few days before his 58th birthday.

headline: Buhari Expresses Worry Over Incessant School Attacks
summarized_story:
President Muhammadu Buhari on Monday directed the military, police and intelligence agencies to ensure safe and early release of all kidnapped victims, expressing concern over incessant attacks on Kaduna and Niger States, largely targeted at students.
While noting ongoing deployment of additional security personnel to all troubled areas, the President in a statement by presidential spokesman, Garba Shehu, urged security outfits to “act swiftly” to rescue all school boys and girls in the affected states and ensure safe return.
President Buhari said the disturbing incidents of kidnapping students, mostly in Northern states, was already threatening to undermine efforts in boosting school enrolments in states that were adjudged educationally backward.
He called on state governments to ensure compliance with UN-supported Safe Schools Programme, which the administration had adopted.
The President described kidnapping as cowardly and despicable, condemning it as an assault on affected families and the nation.

headline: Kyari pushes for cut in payout to oil communities in PIB
summarized_story:

Bandits had stormed the Bethel Baptist High School in the south of Kaduna State overnight and abducted 140 students.

The ESN members were apprehended while engaging security operatives in a gun duel, according to the State Commissioner of Police, Abutu Yaro, who confirmed the arrest to newsmen in Owerri while parading the suspects.

Faith Academy, along Kachia Road near to Jakaranda; Deeper Life Academy, Maraban Rido; Ecwa Secondary School, Ungwar Maje; and Bethel Baptist High School, Damishi are among the schools affected.
St. Peters Minor Seminary in Katari, Prelude Secondary School in Kujama, Ibiso Secondary School in Tashar Iche, and Tulip International (Boys) and Tulip International (Girls) School are among the others.
Goodnews Secondary School, Kujama; Comprehensive Development Institution (CDI), Tudun Mare; and Adventist College, Kujama are also on the list.

Tennis star Naomi Osaka said Monday she wants to be on top form at the Olympics and will take part in press conferences, after pulling out of several tournaments citing her struggles with depression and anxiety.
“I am preparing myself little by little so I can be at the top of my game for the Olympics,” the 23-year-old wrote in a message published by the broadcaster.
The Japanese player had said post-match news conferences were detrimental to her mental health and likened them to “kicking people when they’re down”.
Osaka’s agent said last month that she had withdrawn from Wimbledon to spend time with friends and family.
But he added that she was “excited to play in front of her home fans” at Tokyo 2020, which begins on July 23.

headline: Lagos Assembly passes law to prohibit police from parading suspects
summarized_story:
Lagos State House of Assembly has passed an amended version of the Criminal Justice Law of the State barring the police from parading suspects before the media henceforth.
The bill was passed at a sitting presided over by Deputy Speaker, Wasiu Eshilokun-Sanni, on behalf of Speaker Mudashiru Obasa.
Section 9(A) of the newly passed bill states: “As from the commencement of this law, the police shall refrain from parading any suspect before the media.”The bill also stipulates the conditions under which a policeman can arrest without warrant, one of which is that a person must be reasonably suspected to unlawfully be in possession of firearms or other such dangerous instruments.
A subsection of the bill also barred the police or any other agency from arresting a person “in lieu of any other person in a criminal matter”.
AdvertisementThe bill adds a person who is arrested “shall be given reasonable facilities for obtaining legal advice, bail or making arrangements for defence or release.

headline: Kaduna State Government orders immediate closure of 13 schools
summarized_story:
The Kaduna State Government has ordered the immediate closure of thirteen schools located in areas prone to bandits attack.
The directive was issued to proprietors of private schools in the state by Umma Ahmed, the Director-General of Quality Assurance Authority, Ministry of Education, Kaduna State.
The closure is to take place with immediate effect.
This follows the recent abduction of students from Bethel Baptist college in the state by bandits on Monday.

headline: NSCDC Commandant Zone M. Visits Zamfara Command
summarized_story:
The Zonal Commander of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) in charge of Zone M Mr. Sammani Mohammed Inuwa said the welfare of personnel remains the top most priority of corpZone M of the NSCDC Comprises four commands of Sokoto, Kebbi and Zamfara statesSammani stated this during his one day official visit to the Zamfara state commandHe noted that the service would not relent in its efforts in ensuring that the staff welfare is properly taken care of.
The Zonal Commander appeal to the personnel to redouble their efforts in the discharge of their duty, adding that service will not condone any act of lawlessness and indisciplineAdvertisement” I assured u that all outstanding arrears and allowances of officers and men will be settled in no distance time” he assuresHe commended the Zamfara state Command for establishing women response unit which is first of its kind in the zone.
” I want to commend this Command for establishing Women response team and is the first of its kind in zone M. It is worthy of commendation” Sammani saidAdvertisementResponding, the Zamfara State Commandant, Mr. Akushie Athanasius applauded the Zonal commandant for the visit, describing it as a morale booster for the personnelHe said the Zamfara state command is ever ready to effectively discharge its constitutional responsibilities especially in the ongoing fight against bandits and other criminal elements“I am optimistic that my men are battle ready to face criminals and deal with them decisively” Athanasius saidMr. Athanasius thanked the Zamfara State Government for the cordial relationship and assistance to the command.

headline: Nigeria’s Southern Governors Reject Removal of Electronic Transmission of Election Results
summarized_story:
Governors of Nigeria’s southern region have rejected in strong terms the removal of electronic transmission of election results from the Electoral Amendment Bill 2021.
The governors also rejected the confirmation of exclusive jurisdiction in pre-election matters on the federal high court.
The seventeen governors stated this on Monday at the end of the southern governors’ forum meeting held in Nigeria’s commercial capital Lagos State.
The forum however supports the 5 per cent share of oil revenue to the host communities as proposed by the House of Representatives.
By Abel Ejikeme

headline: Southern Nigeria Governors Demand Next President Should Emerge From South
summarized_story:
Seventeen Governors of Nigeria’s southern region are demanding that the next president of the country emerge from the south.
The governors stated this on Monday at the end of the southern governors’ forum meeting held in Lagos State.
The meeting is a follow-up to the earlier meeting in Asaba, the Delta state capital hosted by the state Governor.
Details LaterBy Abel Ejikeme

headline: Nigeria: Edwin Clark Warns of Possible Hostilities in Niger Delta, Demands Immediate Reversal, Amendment of Passed PIB
summarized_story:
Leader of the Pan-Niger Delta Forum (PANDEF), Edwin Clark has warned of possible hostilities in the Niger Delta region if the recently passed Petroleum Industry Bill (PIB) is not reversed, reviewed and amended.
He cautioned that the “Niger Delta people may be forced to take their destiny into their own hands”.
“It is important to state clearly here to all well-meaning Nigerians that the demand of the oil-bearing communities of the Niger Delta Region was for a minimum of 10% equity participation,” he said.
“We want to warn seriously, that the people of the Niger Delta have had enough of this colonial and oppressive mentality of our Northern brothers and friends.
He demanded that the PIB be reversed, reviewed and amended to ensure that the oil-bearing communities receive not less than 10% of operating cost.

headline: IPOB Commander Confesses To Using Girls For Rituals – Trending with Ojy Okpe
summarized_story:
Yoruba activist, Sunday Adeyemo, popularly known as Sunday Igboho is demanding an apology and 500M Naira in Compensation from the federal government over the invasion of his residence by operatives of the Department of State Security.
Reactions have trailed the arrest of an alleged commander of the Eastern Security Network Benjamin Emeoyiri who over the weekend, confessed to killing, 10 young girls and used their heads to prepare charms for fortification as well as carrying out , multiple attacks in Imo state.
In the meantime the , spokesman of the Indigenous People of Biafra in a statement, denied claims by the alleged commander ..The spokesman Emma powerful, described the ESN commander as a mole planted by the federal government.
Kaduna state governor Nasir El Rufai has come under fire on social media for withdrawing his children from public schools in the state over fear of attacks by Bandits.

headline: Nigeria: Former President Obasanjo Denies Floating Political Party
summarized_story:
A former Nigerian President Olusegun Obasanjo has denied claims that he is floating a political party.
Mr Obasanjo who is currently in Kabul, Afghanistan, as a guest of President Ashraf Ghani, denied the report in a statement by his media aide, Kehinde Akinyemi.
“If anything, Chief Obasanjo’s political party today is the party of Nigerians facing insecurity, unemployment, hunger, poverty, and various other challenging issues.
It is the party of Nigeria which must be saved, kept wholesomely united in peace, security, equity, development and progress.
“Let those who want to use the back door to force Chief Obasanjo to return to partisan politics respect his choice to remain a non-partisan statesman.
